bug.author: ayy345
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
We are trying to convert Tensorflow (1.14+) frozen model to CoreML The model has Mul Operation, and conversion is failing
<denchmark-h:h2>Trace</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>ERROR:root:[TypeInference] Failed to infer type of mul:Mul Traceback (most recent call last): File "lib/python3.6/site-packages/coremltools/converters/nnssa/frontend/graph_pass/type_inference.py", line 171, in visit ret = visitor(node) File "lib/python3.6/site-packages/coremltools/converters/nnssa/frontend/graph_pass/type_inference.py", line 1227, in visit_Mul return self._visit_broadcast(node) File "lib/python3.6/site-packages/coremltools/converters/nnssa/frontend/graph_pass/type_inference.py", line 435, in _visit_broadcast retshape = self._broadcast_shape(node, typea.get_shape(), typeb.get_shape()) File "lib/python3.6/site-packages/coremltools/converters/nnssa/frontend/graph_pass/type_inference.py", line 408, in _broadcast_shape i, node.op, node.name)) ValueError: Incompatible dimension 1 in Mul operation localization_model/poolingatend/mul </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>System environment (please complete the following information):</denchmark-h>
coremltools version (e.g., 3.0b5): 4.0b1, 4.0b2 OS MacOS macOS version (if applicable): 10.15 python version (e.g. 3.7): 3.6 any other relevant information:
e.g. Tensorflow Version 10.14.0
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
May be the converter is mapping Tensorflow's Mul to CoreML's MultiplyLayer instead of MultiplyBroadcastableLayer which supports general broadcasting.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ayy345>@ayy345</denchmark-link> Can you try converting the model with ? You can install it using pip install coremltools==4.0b2
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/DawerG>@DawerG</denchmark-link> Sorry, my bad. I forgot to mention, I used 4.0b1, 4.0b2 versions
